player_typologies.name: Mr. Always Right
player_typologies.summary: Master of Everything has an excessive need to be in control and always be right. They view themselves as superior to you and use various tactics to maintain this sense of grandiosity, including verbal put-downs, criticism, and blame-shifting. They are highly defensive, never admitting fault or accepting responsibility for their actions. They employ a patronizing tone and belittle you to feel powerful and maintain control. They can become hostile when challenged or threatened. Unlike some others with similar tendencies, they do not need excessive validation and are generally consistent.
red_flags: You constantly feel inferior
Twists your arguments to make you seem stupid
He has a derisive tone or mimics your voice
Uses aggressive conversational styles like sarcasm at low volume
Smug and self-assured
Has a contemptuous grin
He uses his own evenness to drive you insane
Not controlling, but only if all of his needs are met

When you disagree with me, that's mistreatment of me

techniques_he_might_use: Presenting oneself as an authority figure/mentor to gain compliance or agreement
Uses communication as a weapon, to win
Misattribution: he renames his flaws as admirable qualities

player_typologies.name: Emotional Predator, Puppet Master, The Svengali
player_typologies.summary: Charming and smooth, the Puppet Master excels at making you believe you're in control, while secretly pulling the strings behind the scenes. Driven by an insatiable need for control over your thoughts, emotions, and actions, he is a master manipulator. Using a combination of charm, deceit, and psychological tactics, he exploits your vulnerabilities to get what he wants, often convincing you that his intentions are harmless or even benevolent. He excels in creating confusion, leading you to question your judgment and your sense of reality. Ultimately, he is an emotional conman—exploitative and deceitful—leaving a trail of hurt, confusion, and broken trust in his wake. Lacking empathy and guided by self-interest, he thrives on the power he gains through manipulation, using others as mere tools to fulfill his needs.
red_flags: He has a weird relationship with social media. Either he isn't on it for vague reasons or is on it too much
He keeps some areas of his life completely separate from you, like his friends or his phone
He is callous
Knows how to make you feel special, but you are often off balance
He is a fantastic lover

Makes you feel safe or protected; makes you feel like his aggressiveness couldn't be directed at you because he loves you
Gives you lots of attention, but moves too fast.
He is an effective salesmanship at your time of need
If you ever lose your temper, you can't just apologize, you have to grovel.
Plus 79 more
techniques_he_might_use: Compromising your integrity, foot in the door
vulnerability_traits: Is an immigrant, documented or undocumented

player_typologies.name: Emotional Invalidator
player_typologies.summary: The Emotional Invalidator seeks to dismiss or undermine your feelings and experiences. He often belittles, ignores, or minimizes your emotional needs, leaving you feeling unheard and unimportant. This pattern can lead to growing self-doubt, diminished self-esteem, and a sense of powerlessness in the relationship. He may use tactics like gaslighting, shifting blame, or denying your emotions in order to maintain control and avoid accountability for his actions. When he tells you that you are overly emotional and that he is logical, he's gaslighting you—because this person is far from logical. His behavior is often a deliberate manipulation to make you doubt your reality.
red_flags: They constantly blame others for their problems and never take responsibility.
They are emotionally distant and unavailable.
He is emotionally unavailable or distant
He seems to think that he is not to be held accountable because of all of the problems he has
Low level emotional assaults that do psychological harm
If things are wrong in my life, it's your fault
If your needs conflict with his, you are self-centered
Since being with him, you feel less bright and competent
He finds little of value in your insights
He is very concerned about you because of your emotional problems
techniques_he_might_use: Inability to maintain emotional connection or display empathy

player_typologies.name: Dr. Jekyll/Mr. Hyde
player_typologies.summary: The Jekyll and Hyde abuser's charming and loving behavior in the early stages of the relationship can be seen as a phase of reconciliation or honeymoon period. However, as the tension builds, the abusive and controlling side emerges, leading to abusive incidents. Afterward, the abuser may switch back to being charming and apologetic, perpetuating the cycle. He has two personalities: one for his partner and another for the public.
flavors_of_abuse: Wants all the focus on his feelings
red_flags: He's chronically unhappy or unlucky
Avoids questions about his past or provides inconsistent information.
Changing the subject or becoming defensive when asked about his personal life.
Resentful of others that seem to have control
They constantly blame others for their problems and never take responsibility.
They have a history of abusive behavior or violence.
They try to isolate you from your friends and family.
They have substance abuse issues or other addictive behaviors.
They are constantly checking up on you and wanting to know your whereabouts.
Your family tells you that they think someone is off with him.

techniques_he_might_use: Endangering you, like leaving you on the side of a highway at night
Actively seeking out multiple sexual partners
trauma_signs: Relationship addiction, inability to move on

player_typologies.name: Mommy Seeker
player_typologies.summary: The Mommy Seeker is attractive because of his initial flattery, attention, gifts, affection, and boyish charm. But he is emotionally needy and dependent, lacks self-confidence, unable to take care of himself, and has a childlike view of the world. He has trouble with intimacy and relies on you for emotional support, while also becoming jealous and possessive. You may feel like you need to take care of everything in the relationship, including cleaning the house, earning the money, and doing the responsible things for the kids.
flavors_of_abuse: Wants all the focus on his feelings
red_flags: His children and other family members have poor boundaries. He over- or undervalues his children or is enmeshed with them

Sad little boy that never had a mom

Have a hole in their soul shaped like their absent parent; but you can't actually ever fill it

Needs constant reassurance
Plus 20 more

player_typologies.name: Man with a Hidden Life
player_typologies.summary: He first presents himself as having a perfect or even ideal life, but he is actually hiding deep secrets and harmful behavior. This man is most likely to be a mixed bag of addictions and mental health disorders.

player_typologies.name: The Nitpicker
player_typologies.summary: This abuser uses criticism, nitpicking, and fault-finding to erode your self-esteem and independence. The Nitpicker tends to be perfectionistic and may use your mistakes or flaws as evidence of his own superiority. He may also set unrealistic expectations or constantly change the rules, leading you to feel like you can never do anything right.

techniques_he_might_use: Using privilege, treating women as objects

player_typologies.name: The Water Torturer
player_typologies.summary: This guy uses relentless and repetitive pattern of verbal and emotional abuse, including sarcasm, ridicule, and humiliation, to wear down your self-esteem and self-worth over time. He may not see his behavior as abusive and instead believe that he is simply joking or being playful. The Water Torturer can be particularly difficult to identify because his abuse often occurs in private and can be subtle, making it hard for you to recognize and articulate the abuse you are experiencing.

player_typologies.name: The Perpetual Victim
player_typologies.summary: The Perpetual Victim is a man who frequently brings up his past traumas and hardships, using them as an excuse to justify his harmful behavior. He often shifts blame onto others for his problems, refusing to take responsibility for his actions. Despite constantly portraying himself as a victim, he never truly empathizes with or acknowledges the struggles of other women. His self-centered nature and lack of genuine empathy make it difficult for him to form meaningful connections. Instead, he manipulates emotionally, resorts to passive-aggressive tactics, and plays the victim role to maintain control over you, making you feel guilty or responsible for his unhappiness.

He gives you the impression that he will harm himself or never get over being wounded if you don't do what he asks.
Does things you never ask for and then wants full reciprocation
Plays up how fragile he is to hide the destruction in his wake
Super passive aggressive; likes to humiliate partner in front of group

You seem to be hurting his feelings constantly, and he expects you to focus endlessly on his hurts

Plus 28 more
techniques_he_might_use: Using privilege, treating women as objects

player_typologies.name: The Terrorist
player_typologies.summary: The Intimidator is someone who seeks control in their relationships by using fear, manipulation, and intimidation. They often rely on aggressive tactics to get their way, using threats or the potential for violence to assert power. With a history of criminal behavior, they may be involved in gangs, extremist groups, or other forms of organized crime. While they may not always act violently, their presence and actions create an environment of fear and tension, making it difficult for others to feel safe or in control of their own lives. The effects of this behavior can be long-lasting, eroding trust and emotional well-being, and leaving those around them feeling vulnerable and powerless.

Incapable of taking women seriously as human beings

An unwillingness to seek help or work on the relationship

player_typologies.name: The Drill Sergeant
player_typologies.summary: The Drill Sergeant is rigid, demanding, and highly controlling. They have a clear vision of how things should be and expect everyone around them to follow their rules and standards without question. Often appearing confident and assertive, they take charge of situations, sometimes to the point of overbearingness. They demand excellence and obedience, and if they don't get it, they can become frustrated or dismissive. Their relationships are structured around their need for control, and they struggle with flexibility or adapting to others' needs. While they may seem reliable and strong on the surface, their lack of emotional warmth and sensitivity to others' feelings can make those around them feel restricted, unsupported, and constantly under pressure.

Incapable of taking women seriously as human beings

techniques_he_might_use: Presenting oneself as an authority figure/mentor to gain compliance or agreement

player_typologies.name: The Addict
player_typologies.summary: The Addict is characterized by an obsessive and compulsive addiction to drugs, alcohol, sex, gambling, or other substances or activities. He is often in denial about his addiction and may manipulate those around him to enable his habit. The Addict is often emotionally unstable and unpredictable, making it difficult for those around him to maintain a stable relationship. His behavior can be erratic and impulsive, and he may resort to lying, stealing, or other forms of illegal or unethical behavior to support his addiction.

player_typologies.name: The Sensitive Guy
player_typologies.summary: This guy presents himself as emotionally in tune and considerate of your feelings, but in reality, he uses this as a guise to manipulate and control you. This abuser may play the sensitive card as a way to guilt or shame you into compliance, while simultaneously dismissing or invalidating your emotions and needs. The Sensitive Guy may also use his perception of your emotions as a way to deflect from his own abusive behavior and manipulate her into questioning her own experiences. The effects of abuse can be particularly insidious, as it may be difficult for the victim to recognize and articulate the manipulation and control tactics being used.
flavors_of_abuse: Wants all the focus on his feelings

player_typologies.name: The Charmer
player_typologies.summary: Charmers often have a magnetic personality and can make their targets feel special and valued, but may not be genuine in their intentions.
flavors_of_abuse: Provides insincere but effective emotional support

player_typologies.name: The Seducer
player_typologies.summary: The Seducer is a player who uses his charisma, charm, and sexual magnetism to seduce and manipulate his targets. He is a master of the art of seduction, using various techniques such as flattery, eye contact, physical touch, and innuendo to make his target feel like she is the only one who matters. He is like the Player but more sophisticated, with a broader range of psychological manipulation tactics. Like the Emotional Predator, but more motivated by pleasure and conquest than dominance and control.
flavors_of_abuse: Provides insincere but effective emotional support

player_typologies.name: The Libertine
player_typologies.summary: The Libertine is driven by a strong desire for pleasure and indulgence in various forms, not limited to sexual encounters. His focus is on seeking pleasure and gratification in all aspects of life, including physical, emotional, and sensory experiences. While seduction may be a means to achieve this pleasure, it is ultimately the enjoyment and gratification derived from the experience itself that holds the greatest allure for The Libertine. The thrill of seduction, the excitement of new encounters, and the pursuit of sensual and hedonistic pleasures are at the core of his motivations.

player_typologies.name: The Demand Man
player_typologies.summary: He expects the people around him, especially his partner, to cater to his needs and adhere to his rules, often without reciprocation. This type feels justified in making demands, no matter how unreasonable, and sees compromise as a weakness. Boundaries are obstacles to his control, and he uses both direct commands and subtle manipulation to erode them. His partner may find themselves constantly yielding, feeling pressured to meet his standards and sacrificing their independence to avoid conflict. Ultimately, the Demand Man's primary goal is to maintain a dynamic where his authority and desires come first, with little regard for equality or mutual respect.

player_typologies.name: The Clinger
player_typologies.summary: The Clinger is someone who has a strong emotional need to be constantly close to you. They often struggle to handle their own emotions and rely on you to help them feel stable. When there's any emotional distance, they can become anxious, upset, or even angry, which puts a lot of pressure on the relationship. This type has difficulty respecting personal space or boundaries. They tend to get emotionally tangled up with you, making it hard for them to separate their feelings from yours. They may constantly seek your attention, approval, and reassurance, which can make you feel responsible for managing their emotional needs. If they feel ignored or distant, they might react strongly, leaving you feeling drained and trapped in their emotional ups and downs.
flavors_of_abuse: Wants all the focus on his feelings
red_flags: Gives you lots of attention, but moves too fast.
Doesn't want restrictions on his freedom
He watches you like a hawk
He tries to isolate you

Hates his mom
Needs constant reassurance; does this by invoking your pity

Becomes frantic at the end of a relationship
Plus 17 more

player_typologies.name: The Rambo, The Iron Fist
player_typologies.summary: Lundy Bancroft's Rambo type is a dominant, macho, controlling, and surveillance-oriented abuser. This type of abuser typically seeks to establish a power imbalance in the relationship by being aggressive, intimidating, and dominant. They use various tactics to control their partner, including physical violence, emotional abuse, and financial control. The Rambo type may try to isolate their partner from friends and family, or constantly monitor their partner's movements and activities. They may also use threats or intimidation to maintain control over their partner.

player_typologies.name: The Player
player_typologies.summary: The Player is primarily motivated by the need for control and dominance over you. He is often charming, charismatic, and confident, making him very attractive to many women. However, once in a relationship, The Player will use a variety of tactics to maintain control and power over you such as manipulation, lies, and deceit. He is not interested in emotional connection or intimacy with you but instead sees the relationship as a game to be won. He may use sex as a means of control or manipulation and will often engage in infidelity or other forms of deception.

Gives you lots of attention, but moves too fast.

player_typologies.name: Mr. Unavailable
player_typologies.summary: Mr. Unavailable is a type of man who presents himself as emotionally unavailable, either by actively distancing himself or by avoiding emotional connections altogether. He is often charming and alluring, but keeps a distance that is just enough to prevent true intimacy. Mr. Unavailable is often preoccupied with his own needs and desires, and tends to be selfish and unreliable. He may have a pattern of pursuing women, only to lose interest or disappear once he gets what he wants. This type of man can be incredibly frustrating for women who are looking for a genuine emotional connection, and often leaves them feeling confused and rejected.

player_typologies.name: The Freewheeler
player_typologies.summary: The player's natural inclination for seeking novelty, excitement, and constant stimulation can be amplified by the impulsivity and distractability. This may lead to a pattern of impulsive decisions, inconsistent behavior, and difficulty sustaining focus or commitment in relationships. These traits may contribute to a cycle of short-lived connections, superficial interactions, and a constant need for new sources of attention and validation. Their difficulties with organization and time management may also contribute to a lack of reliability and follow-through.

Doesn't want restrictions on his freedom

player_typologies.name: Emotionally Unavailable Man
player_typologies.summary: The Emotionally Unavailable Man struggles to fully engage in a committed and emotionally intimate relationship. He may exhibit patterns of emotional distancing, difficulty in expressing vulnerable emotions, and a fear of deep emotional connection. This type of man often struggles with his own emotional availability, leading to a cycle of inconsistent behavior and mixed signals. He may create a sense of closeness and then withdraw, leaving you feeling confused and emotionally neglected. He may have difficulties with intimacy due to past traumas, fear of rejection or vulnerability, or an avoidant attachment style.
red_flags: They are emotionally distant and unavailable.

player_typologies.name: Booty Call
player_typologies.summary: The Booty Call refers to a casual sexual arrangement between two individuals without any commitment or emotional connection. It typically involves late-night calls or messages solely for the purpose of engaging in physical intimacy. This type of arrangement often lacks the emotional depth and communication found in a committed relationship, focusing primarily on fulfilling sexual desires. While some may engage in a booty call with clear understanding and consent, it can also lead to emotional complications and unfulfilled expectations.
red_flags: They are emotionally distant and unavailable.

player_typologies.name: Assclown
player_typologies.summary: An Assclown is a particular type of unavailable and disrespectful partner. He exhibits a range of negative behaviors, such as inconsistency, manipulative tactics, emotional unavailability, and a lack of respect for his partner's boundaries and feelings. He may engage in hot-and-cold behavior, make empty promises, or prioritize his own needs and desires above yours. He is like Mr. Unavailable, but with a woman-hating bent.

player_typologies.name: The Passive Aggressive
player_typologies.summary: Unlike the Covert Manipulator, the Passive Aggressive player is deathly afraid of conflict and his anger leaks out with techniques where he drags his feet and expresses his anger and resentment in sideways techniques. The passive aggressive man is emotionally immature and might not be aware of how manipulative he is. He also tends towards tactics like procrastination and peevishness that erode your relationship, but unlike the covert manipulator, he doesn't use tactics that erode your personality itself, like gaslighting.

player_typologies.name: Narcissistic
player_typologies.summary: With an insatiable hunger for admiration and validation, the narcissist's ego knows no bounds, fueling an insidious sense of entitlement and grandiosity. Their sense of self is inflated, untouchable, a shield against the perceived threats of vulnerability and shame. To the narcissist, relationships are nothing more than sources of narcissistic supply, a means to an end in their endless quest for power and control. But beneath the carefully crafted facade lies a fragile and wounded self, a shadow that looms dark and deep, yet remains hidden from view.
flavors_of_abuse: Wants all the focus on his feelings

player_typologies.summary: A player who understands their target's desires and fulfills them, creating a deep emotional connection. Ideal lovers are skilled at making their targets feel understood and desired, but may not be genuine in their affections.

player_typologies.name: The Dandy
player_typologies.summary: The Dandy embodies a unique persona that exudes style, confidence, and a refined sense of self. This archetype encompasses the art of personal presentation and stands out as a symbol of elegance and sophistication. The Dandy pays meticulous attention to fashion, grooming, and overall aesthetics, using these elements as tools to express individuality and create a distinct identity.

player_typologies.name: The Natural
player_typologies.summary: A player who appears uninterested or aloof, creating an air of mystery and allure. Naturals often have a magnetic presence and effortlessly attract others, but may struggle with commitment and genuine emotional connection.

After a period of intense attention, his interest wanes and he looks at other women
He is a fantastic lover
Gives you lots of attention, but moves too fast.

player_typologies.name: The Charismatic
player_typologies.summary: A player who uses his natural leadership abilities and compelling personality to attract and seduce. Charismatics often have a strong sense of purpose and vision, and can inspire his targets to follow him, but may also be manipulative and self-serving.
flavors_of_abuse: Provides insincere but effective emotional support
red_flags: He engages in attention-seeking behaviors or seek validation and admiration from others
Excessive focus on personal image
He prioritizes appearance, material possessions, or external validation over deeper connections or genuine emotions
Claiming to have or have had a high-status occupation with no proof
Changing the subject or becoming defensive when asked about his personal life.
Your family tells you that they think someone is off with him.
Knows how to make you feel special, but you are often off balance
Poor follow through on promises
He is hot and cold, inconsistent in affection and attention
He has a weird relationship with social media. Either he isn't on it for vague reasons or is on it too much
Plus 17 more

player_typologies.name: The Star
player_typologies.summary: A captivating figure with charm, allure, and seemingly unattainable qualities. The Star's ability to maintain a sense of distance, coupled with his natural charisma, can leave a profound impact on his admirers and subjects of his seductive prowess.
red_flags: He engages in attention-seeking behaviors or seek validation and admiration from others
Excessive focus on personal image
He prioritizes appearance, material possessions, or external validation over deeper connections or genuine emotions
Avoids questions about his past or provides inconsistent information.
Changing the subject or becoming defensive when asked about his personal life.
Claiming to have or have had a high-status occupation with no proof
They are emotionally distant and unavailable.
He is constantly flirting; maybe he even hits on women close to you like friends or sisters
Knows how to make you feel special, but you are often off balance
Aloof and distracted. He is not trying to find himself in you, but spinning plates
